titlestmt.titleproper: Mackenzie, A. mss., dates unknown LMC 2939
titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Anna Mackenzie, dates unknown, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Ava Dickerson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:33:42 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Mackenzie, A. mss. consist of correspondence by nurse Anna Mackenzie, as well as research materials and transcriptions gathered by author Larita Killian.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Born to Effie Chandler, a participant in the Orphan Train program to Indiana, Anna Rouch Mackenzie worked as a nurse in Chicago before marrying a South African rancher and moving to Zimbabwe (then called Southern Rhodesia).

LaRita Jean Rouch Killian, CPA, is a professor of accounting at Indiana University-Purdue University Columbus and a faculty research fellow for the Center for Business and Economic Research at Ball State University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of letters of Anna Mackenzie, along with transcriptions and related research materials gathered by Killian for her book Zimbabwe Bound: A Woman's Journey through Africa. Killian relies heavily on Mackenzie's correspondence in the book to chronicle her life.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged following original order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Mackenzie, A. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
